user_error_text: I can't browse the web; Wi-Fi connected but no internet happened after reboot
symptoms: Connected to Wi-Fi but web pages won't load; ping fails to external IP
cause: Router/ISP issue, DNS problem, or corrupted network stack on device
step_1: Restart Wi-Fi on your PC and reboot the router (unplug 10s → plug back in).
step_2: Run Windows Network Troubleshooter: Settings → Network & Internet → Troubleshoot.
step_3: Flush DNS and renew IP: open admin Command Prompt and run ipconfig /flushdns && ipconfig /release && ipconfig /renew.
step_4: Reset network stack: netsh winsock reset && netsh int ip reset, then restart PC.
step_5: If other devices also lack internet, contact ISP; if only your device, check adapter drivers or reinstall adapter.
verification: Network functions normally: webpages load, ping to external IP succeeds, no intermittent drops.
log_snippet: NetAdapter: Wi-Fi connected but no internet - adapter not found

user_error_text: My computer shows "No valid IP configuration"
symptoms: Computer shows "No valid IP configuration" error; cannot connect to internet; network adapter shows limited or no connectivity
cause: DHCP server not assigning IP address, network adapter driver issue, or corrupted network stack
step_1:
✅ Step 1: Restart Network Devices (VERY IMPORTANT)
Turn OFF: [Modem | Router | Computer]
Wait 2 minutes
Turn ON in this order:
Modem → wait for stable lights
Router → wait 1 minute
Computer
📌 This fixes most DHCP/IP assignment issues.
step_2:
🔌 Step 2: Check Ethernet / Wi-Fi Connection
If using Ethernet:
Try a different LAN cable
Try a different router port
If using Wi-Fi:
Click Wi-Fi → Disconnect
Reconnect and re-enter password
✔️ Loose cables or weak Wi-Fi cause IP failure.
step_3:
🧪 Step 3: Renew IP Address (MOST EFFECTIVE)
Press Win + R → type cmd
Right-click Command Prompt → Run as administrator
Run: ipconfig /release AND ipconfig /renew
✔️ Requests a fresh IP from the router.
step_4:
🛑 Step 4: Disable & Enable Network Adapter
Press Win + X → Network Connections
Click Advanced network settings
Disable your network adapter
Wait 10 seconds
Enable it again
✔️ Restarts the network interface cleanly.
step_5:
🧰 Step 5: Update or Reinstall Network Driver
Win + X → Device Manager
Expand Network adapters
Right-click your adapter:
Try Update driver
If not fixed → Uninstall device
Restart PC (Windows reinstalls driver)
📌 Broken drivers are a common cause.
verification: Network adapter shows valid IP address (not 169.254.x.x); internet connection works; ipconfig shows proper gateway and DNS

cause: Router/ISP issue, DNS problem, proxy/VPN misconfiguration, or network adapter driver issue
step_1:

Test internet on a phone or another PC using the same router
Results:
❌ No device has internet → Router / ISP issue
✔️ Other devices work → PC-specific issue
📌 This isolates the problem quickly.
step_2:
🔄 Step 2: Restart Modem, Router & PC
Turn OFF: [Modem | Router | Computer]
Wait 2 minutes
Turn ON in this order:
Modem → wait for stable lights
Router → wait 1 minute
Computer
✔️ Fixes DHCP and gateway glitches.
step_3:

Try a different Ethernet cable
Plug into a different LAN port on the router
Avoid LAN splitters or hubs
📌 A bad cable or port can show "connected" but pass no data.
step_4:
⚙️ Step 4: Check IPv4 & DNS Settings
Settings → Network & Internet → Advanced network settings
More network adapter options
Right-click Ethernet → Properties
Select Internet Protocol Version 4 (IPv4) → Properties
Ensure:
✔️ Obtain an IP address automatically
✔️ Obtain DNS server address automatically
step_5:

Settings → Network & Internet → Proxy
Turn OFF "Use a proxy server"
Disble any VPN software
Restart PC

symptoms: Browser shows "DNS server not responding" error; websites do not load by name but work with IP addresses
cause: Corrupted DNS cache, ISP DNS server issues, proxy/VPN interference, or security software blocking DNS
step_1:
✅ Step 1: Check Internet on Other Devices (VERY IMPORTANT)
Test internet on your phone or another PC using the same network
Results:
❌ No device works → Router / ISP DNS issue
✔️ Other devices work → PC-specific problem

step_2:
🔄 Step 2: Restart Modem, Router & PC
Turn OFF: [Modem | Router | Computer]
Wait 2 minutes
Turn ON in this order:
Modem → wait for stable lights
Router → wait 1 minute
Computer
✔️ Fixes most DNS and IP cache issues.
step_3:

Open Command Prompt (Admin) and run:
ipconfig /flushdns
ipconfig /release
ipconfig /renew
netsh winsock reset
Restart your PC.

Click OK and restart browser
✔️ Uses Google's stable public DNS.

Disable any VPN
Temporarily disable third-party antivirus/firewall
📌 These often block DNS requests.

Select Internet Protocol Version 4 (IPv4) → Properties
Use: Preferred DNS: 8.8.8.8 | Alternate DNS: 8.8.4.4
Click OK
📌 Fixes slow or unreachable ISP DNS servers.
step_5:
🔧 Step 5: Clear Browser Cache / Try Another Browser
Clear browser cache & cookies
Test the site in: Edge | Firefox | Chrome (if not already)
✔️ Rules out browser-specific problems.

user_error_text: The internet keeps disconnecting frequently
symptoms: Internet connection drops frequently; requires reconnection multiple times
cause: Router/ISP instability, weak Wi-Fi signal, network adapter power saving, or outdated drivers
step_1:
✅ Step 1: Check If the Problem Is Only on Your PC (VERY IMPORTANT)
Test internet on a phone or another computer on the same network
Results:
❌ All devices disconnect → Router / ISP issue
✔️ Only your PC disconnects → PC-specific issue
📌 This step decides where to focus.
step_2:
🔄 Step 2: Restart Modem, Router & PC
Turn OFF: [Modem | Router | Computer]
Wait 2 minutes
Turn ON in this order:
Modem → wait for stable lights
Router → wait 1 minute
Computer
✔️ Fixes temporary drops and IP conflicts.
step_3:
📶 Step 3: Improve Wi-Fi Signal (If Using Wi-Fi)
Move closer to the router
Avoid walls, metal objects, microwaves
Switch router to 5 GHz (if available)
Place router in an open, elevated area
📌 Weak signal = frequent disconnects.
step_4:
🔌 Step 4: Disable Network Power Saving (MOST EFFECTIVE)
Win + X → Device Manager
Expand Network adapters
Right-click your adapter → Properties
Go to Power Management
❌ Uncheck Allow the computer to turn off this device to save power
Click OK and restart
✔️ Prevents Windows from cutting your internet.
step_5:
🔧 Step 5: Update or Reinstall Network Driver
Device Manager → Network adapters
Right-click adapter: Update driver | If not fixed → Uninstall device
Restart PC (driver reinstalls automatically)
📌 Outdated drivers often cause drops.
verification: Network functions normally; internet access restored; no error messages

user_error_text: I am getting a proxy server error while browsing
symptoms: Browser shows proxy server errors; cannot access websites
cause: Proxy settings enabled, VPN interference, malware, or browser proxy misconfiguration
step_1:
✅ Step 1: Turn OFF Proxy Settings (MOST EFFECTIVE)
Go to Settings → Network & Internet → Proxy
Under Manual proxy setup: ❌ Turn OFF Use a proxy server
Under Automatic proxy setup: ❌ Turn OFF Automatically detect settings
Close settings and restart the browser
📌 Many proxy errors are caused by leftover or auto-detected proxy configs.
step_2:
🔄 Step 2: Restart Browser & Computer
Close all browsers
Restart your PC
Open the browser and test again
✔️ Clears stuck proxy sessions.
step_3:
🌍 Step 3: Check Browser Proxy Settings
Google Chrome / Edge
Settings → System
Open Your computer's proxy settings
Ensure proxy is disabled
📌 Browser-level proxy can override Windows settings.

Step 4: Disable VPN & Security Software Temporarily
Turn OFF any VPN
Temporarily disable third-party antivirus/firewall
Test browsing again
📌 VPNs often force proxy rules that break connections.
step_4:
🧪 Step 5: Check for Malware (VERY IMPORTANT)
Open Windows Security
Run a Full scan
If possible, run Offline scan
⚠️ Malware commonly changes proxy settings without permission.
verification: Network functions normally; internet access restored; no error messages

user_error_text: My PC shows an IP conflict detected error
symptoms: Windows shows "IP conflict detected" error; network connectivity issues
cause: Multiple devices using same IP address, static IP conflicts, or router DHCP issues
step_1:
✅ Step 1: Restart Your PC & Router (VERY IMPORTANT)
Turn OFF your computer
Restart the router (wait until internet lights are stable)
Turn ON your computer
📌 This forces the router to assign a new unique IP address.
step_2:
🔄 Step 2: Release & Renew IP Address (MOST EFFECTIVE)
Press Win + R → type cmd
Right-click Command Prompt → Run as administrator
Run: ipconfig /release | ipconfig /renew
✔️ Requests a fresh IP from the router.
step_3:
⚙️ Step 3: Ensure DHCP Is Enabled
Settings → Network & Internet
Advanced network settings → More network adapter options
Right-click your active adapter → Properties
Select Internet Protocol Version 4 (IPv4) → Properties
Ensure:
✔️ Obtain an IP address automatically
✔️ Obtain DNS server address automatically
❌ Manual IP settings often cause conflicts.
step_4:
🛑 Step 4: Check for Duplicate Devices

Look for:
Another PC using the same IP
Old devices still connected
Network printers or cameras with static IPs
Restart or disconnect unused devices
📌 Static IP devices are a common cause.

📡 Step 5: Reboot or Reset the Router
Restart router once more
If issue keeps happening:
Log in to router (e.g. 192.168.1.1)
Ensure DHCP server is enabled
Reduce DHCP lease conflicts
✔️ Fixes router-side IP duplication.
verification: Network functions normally; internet access restored; no error messages

user_error_text: The network adapter is missing from my computer
symptoms: Network adapter not visible in Settings or Device Manager; no network connectivity
cause: Adapter disabled, driver missing, hardware failure, or Windows not detecting adapter
step_1:
✅ Step 1: Restart & Check Basic Settings (VERY IMPORTANT)
Restart your PC once
Go to Settings → Network & Internet
Check if Wi-Fi / Ethernet appears
📌 Sometimes the adapter is temporarily not loaded.
step_2:
🔍 Step 2: Check Device Manager (MOST IMPORTANT)
Press Win + X → Device Manager
Expand Network adapters
Check carefully:
✔️ Adapter listed → may be disabled
❌ Nothing listed → driver missing or hardware disabled
Also check: View → Show hidden devices
step_3:
🔄 Step 3: Enable the Network Adapter
Right-click the adapter
Click Enable device
Restart PC
✔️ Disabled adapters disappear from network settings.
step_4:
💾 Step 4: Install / Reinstall Network Drivers (MOST EFFECTIVE)
Identify your PC/Laptop model
Go to the manufacturer's official website
Download: Wi-Fi driver & Ethernet (LAN) driver
Install drivers and restart
📌 Windows often cannot install correct network drivers automatically.
step_5:
🧪 Step 5: Scan for Hardware Changes
Open Device Manager
Click Action → Scan for hardware changes
✔️ Forces Windows to re-detect missing hardware.
verification: Network functions normally; internet access restored; no error messages
